pullRequest.body:
This is a fundamental operator in discrete Fourier analysis. For example, it is the operator relating convolution and difference convolution: https://yaeldillies.github.io/LeanAPAP/docs/LeanAPAP/Prereqs/Convolution/Discrete/Defs.html#conv_conjneg

From LeanAPAP


---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [7a9af834ab](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16181/commits/7a9af834ab7991b81650cbc21169bab87106e959)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Star.Order`|-544|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Star.Basic`|544|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Star.Conjneg`|562|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Star.Conjneg`|651|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ conjneg`
`+ conjnegRingHom`
`+ conjneg_add`
`+ conjneg_apply`
`+ conjneg_bijective`
`+ conjneg_conj`
`+ conjneg_conjneg`
`+ conjneg_eq_one`
`+ conjneg_eq_zero`
`+ conjneg_inj`
`+ conjneg_injective`
`+ conjneg_involutive`
`+ conjneg_mul`
`+ conjneg_ne_conjneg`
`+ conjneg_ne_one`
`+ conjneg_ne_zero`
`+ conjneg_neg`
`+ conjneg_neg'`
`+ conjneg_nonneg`
`+ conjneg_nonpos`
`+ conjneg_one`
`+ conjneg_pos`
`+ conjneg_prod`
`+ conjneg_sub`
`+ conjneg_sum`
`+ conjneg_surjective`
`+ conjneg_zero`
`+ sum_conjneg`
`+ support_conjneg`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
Can you link to an example of where this is useful in the PR description?

> Can you link to an example of where this is useful in the PR description?

One reason this operator comes up a lot is because the conj (Fourier transform of f)  = Fourier transform of (conjneg f). So whenever you are using both Fourier analysis and the conjugation operator conjneg is around.

For example, the absolute value of (Fourier transform of f)^2 is equal to the Fourier transform of f * conjneg f.

Sorry, what I meant is not "when does this come up mathematically", but more "when is it very inconvenient to write `fun x ↦ conj (f (-x))` or `conj (f <| -∙)` instead"? Would having notation for `star` make this more bearable?

`conj (f <| -∙)` is invalid syntax (gives `expected token` at the `·`). `fun x ↦ conj (f (-x))` is pretty verbose (and notation for `conj` (as a reminder this is already notation!) won't fix it) and is inconvenient for stating lemmas like `conjneg (f + g) = conjneg f + conjneg g`, `conjneg (f ∗ g) = conjneg f ∗ conjneg g` or `f ∗ conjneg g = f ○ g` (where `∗` is convolution and `○` difference convolution).

There are two particular points of concern for me:
* There are at least two different spellings of `conjneg`, namely `fun x ↦ conj (f (-x))` and `fun x ↦ conj f (-x)`.
* `conjneg f` is used unapplied. `conjneg f x` never appears in LeanAPAP.

Having a single named function solves both issues.

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10695123745/job/29648029447)
Canceled.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10695475388/job/29648979872)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10695475388/job/29648980765)
bors d+
bors d+
Could be nice to additionally say here the way in which it's useful. eg, that convolution with conjneg f is adjoint to convolution with f
Does it make sense to make this a bundled ring hom?

I don't like making functions bundled by default because it makes them always be prepended with `⇑`, have their API dispersed across the general hom APIs and their own, and is generally little to not useful. I have instead added a bundled version `conjnegRingHom`
If you move this to line 47, then you can very slightly golf the proofs of `conjneg_{sum,prod}`.
I've golfed them even further (and that doesn't even use `conjnegRingHom` 😁)

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma conjneg_prod (s : Finset ι) (f : ι → G → R) :
    conjneg (∏ i ∈ s, f i) = ∏ i ∈ s, conjneg (f i) := by ext; simp
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Conjugation-negation operator
